explanation: Your endometrial lining is {{lining_thickness}}mm with {{lining_pattern}} pattern. For FET, we need 7-12mm with trilaminar (three-layer) pattern. Your estrogen (E2) is {{e2_level}} pg/mL.
next_steps: {{next_action}} - Continue estrogen, add progesterone on {{progesterone_start_date}} / Need more estrogen, recheck in 3 days / Perfect! Transfer scheduled {{transfer_date}}
reassurance: {{reassurance}} - Lining is building nicely! / Great lining - ready for transfer! / Almost there, just needs a bit more time.
call_to_action: {{action}} - Keep taking estrogen patches/pills as prescribed / Start progesterone {{route}} on {{date}} / Confirm transfer attendance

explanation: Aapki endometrial lining {{lining_thickness}}mm hai with {{lining_pattern}} pattern. FET ke liye 7-12mm chahiye trilaminar (teen layer) pattern ke sath. Aapka estrogen (E2) {{e2_level}} pg/mL hai.
next_steps: {{next_action}} - Estrogen continue, progesterone {{progesterone_start_date}} se start / Aur estrogen chahiye, 3 din mein recheck / Perfect! Transfer {{transfer_date}} ko scheduled
reassurance: {{reassurance}} - Lining achhe se build ho rahi hai! / Bilkul perfect lining - transfer ready! / Bas thoda aur time chahiye.
call_to_action: {{action}} - Estrogen patches/pills lete raho / Progesterone {{route}} {{date}} se start karo / Transfer confirm karo

context: Your lining is perfect. Starting progesterone today transforms your uterus to 'receptive mode' for embryo.
explanation: You'll take {{progesterone_type}} {{progesterone_dose}} {{route}} starting TODAY. Progesterone makes the lining sticky and receptive. Your transfer will be {{transfer_days}} days after starting progesterone (Day {{transfer_day}}).
next_steps: {{instructions}} - Vaginal suppositories: Insert 2x/day (morning/night), lie down 30 min after / PIO injections: Upper outer buttock, alternate sides, warm compress after / Oral pills: Take with food
reassurance: Progesterone is crucial for implantation! Side effects normal: discharge (vaginal), soreness (injections), drowsiness (oral). Don't worry! üíö
call_to_action: Take FIRST DOSE tonight. Set phone reminder for consistent timing. Log each dose. Transfer on {{transfer_date}}!

explanation: Today's scan shows the follicle has ruptured and LH surge confirmed (LH: {{lh_level}}). Your body released the egg naturally. Now progesterone will rise naturally, preparing your lining for transfer.
next_steps: No trigger shot needed! Transfer scheduled for {{transfer_date}} (Day {{transfer_day}} post-ovulation). May add progesterone support on Day {{progesterone_day}}.
reassurance: Natural FET mimics normal pregnancy timing - some studies show better success rates! Your body knows what to do. üåø
call_to_action: Continue monitoring. Light spotting normal (ovulation bleeding). Come for transfer with full bladder!

context: Your embryo thawed perfectly this morning!
explanation: We thawed {{number_embryos}} {{stage}} embryo(s) - Grade {{original_grade}}. Post-thaw survival: {{survival_rate}}%. The embryo(s) re-expanded beautifully and look {{quality_description}}! This is exactly what we want to see.
next_steps: Transfer at {{transfer_time}} today. Arrive 30 min early with FULL BLADDER. We'll transfer {{embryos_to_transfer}} embryo(s).
reassurance: Perfect thaw survival means the embryo is resilient and healthy! Frozen embryos actually have HIGHER success rates than fresh. You're in great hands! üí™
call_to_action: Drink 1 liter water 1 hour before transfer. Bring partner for support. Wear comfy clothes. See you soon!

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, this is the embryology lab calling with great news.
context: We thawed your embryo this morning, and I wanted to let you know it survived the thaw beautifully.
explanation: [SPEAK CLEARLY] So, we thawed {{number_embryos}} embryo - it was a {{stage}} at Grade {{original_grade}} when we froze it. The survival rate was {{survival_rate}}%, which means all the cells are intact. After thawing, the embryo needs to re-expand, kind of like waking up, and yours did that perfectly. It looks really healthy.
next_steps: Your transfer is scheduled for {{transfer_time}}, so we'll see you in a few hours. Please arrive 30 minutes early with a full bladder - that helps us see the uterus clearly on ultrasound. We'll be transferring this embryo today.
reassurance: [EMPATHY] I know there's always anxiety about whether the embryo will survive the thaw, so I'm really happy to tell you it went perfectly. Frozen embryos actually have success rates that are as good or better than fresh transfers, so you're in a great position.
call_to_action: Just make sure you drink about a liter of water starting one hour before your appointment, and wear something comfortable. Do you have any questions about the transfer procedure?
contact_info: [WAIT] Okay, we'll see you soon. If anything comes up, call us at {{clinic_phone}}.

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, it's Dr. {{doctor_name}}. I need to discuss today's scan with you.
context: [EMPATHETIC TONE] Unfortunately, your lining isn't responding the way we'd hoped.
explanation: Today's scan showed your lining at {{lining_thickness}}mm. Despite {{days_on_estrogen}} days of estrogen at {{estrogen_dose}}, it's still below the 7mm minimum we need for a safe transfer. A thin lining reduces the chance of implantation significantly - we'd be setting you up for disappointment and wasting a precious embryo.
next_steps: [CLEAR INSTRUCTIONS] I recommend we cancel this FET cycle. You can stop the estrogen, your period will come in about a week. Then we'll try a different protocol next month - maybe add vaginal estrogen, try estrogen injections, use Viagra suppositories to increase blood flow, or even consider growth hormone priming.
reassurance: [EMPATHY] I know this is frustrating - you've been taking medications and preparing for transfer. But please know this is actually quite common, and many patients who have thin lining one cycle respond beautifully to a modified protocol the next cycle. We've learned your body needs a different approach, and that's valuable information.
call_to_action: Stop estrogen today. When your period starts, call us and we'll schedule a consultation to plan the next cycle with adjustments. No rush - we'll go at your pace.
contact_info: I'm sorry we're in this position. Any questions for me now? You can reach me at {{clinic_phone}} anytime.

context: Your follicle is ready for trigger!
explanation: Day {{cycle_day}} scan shows: Lead follicle {{follicle_size}}mm (perfect!), Lining {{lining_thickness}}mm {{lining_pattern}} (excellent!), LH {{lh_level}} (almost surging). We'll trigger ovulation to control exact timing for transfer.
next_steps: Trigger shot: {{trigger_type}} {{trigger_dose}} TONIGHT at {{trigger_time}} exactly. Transfer in {{transfer_days}} days on {{transfer_date}}. Start progesterone Day {{progesterone_day}}.
reassurance: Modified natural = your body does the work, we just fine-tune timing! Best of both worlds - natural hormones + precise control. üéØ
call_to_action: Take trigger EXACTLY at {{trigger_time}}. Set alarm! Miss it = cycle cancelled. No sex after trigger. Relax and prepare!

context: Aapka FET successful raha! Beta hCG POSITIVE!
explanation: Aapka hCG level {{beta_value}} mIU/mL hai (50 se upar = pregnant)! Frozen embryo perfectly implant hua! {{days_post_transfer}} days post-transfer ke liye ye bahut achha number hai!
next_steps: 48 ghante baad repeat beta {{next_test_date}} ko. SAARI medicines continue (estrogen + progesterone dono). Pehli ultrasound 6 weeks pe.
reassurance: Frozen embryo transfer ka success bahut achha hota hai! Aapka embryo thaw survive kiya aur implant bhi ho gaya - double victory! Ye real hai! üíöüë∂
call_to_action: Aaram karo, kuch bhari nahi uthana, stress nahi lena. Bleeding/cramping turant batao. Meds bilkul time pe lena (bhulna nahi!).

explanation: Unfortunately, {{damaged_count}} embryo(s) did not survive the thaw with sufficient quality for transfer ({{survival_rate}}% survival). This happens in ~5-10% of thaws. We immediately thawed {{second_embryo_count}} more embryo(s), which survived perfectly and look great!
next_steps: Transfer proceeding as scheduled at {{transfer_time}} with the newly thawed embryo(s). You still have {{remaining_frozen}} frozen embryos in storage.
reassurance: Having backup embryos is exactly why we freeze multiple! The embryos we're transferring now are excellent quality. One thaw failure doesn't predict future failures - it's random. üí™
call_to_action: Transfer still on track. Come as planned with full bladder. Don't let this shake your confidence - we have great embryos ready!

context: After {{failed_transfers}} failed transfers with good embryos, we need to investigate why.
explanation: ERA (Endometrial Receptivity Analysis) test tells us your exact 'implantation window' - when your lining is most receptive. 30% of women have a displaced window (need progesterone for more/less time before transfer). This could explain the failures.
next_steps: Mock FET cycle: Take estrogen + progesterone as normal. On 'transfer day,' we do endometrial biopsy instead (5 min, mild cramping). Lab analyzes 238 genes. Results in 3 weeks tell us if we need to adjust progesterone timing.
reassurance: ERA has helped many patients with repeated failures finally succeed - it's like finding the missing puzzle piece! Cost ~‚Çπ30-40K but could save future transfers. üî¨
call_to_action: Think it over, discuss with partner. Not urgent but worth considering before next FET. Schedule when ready.

context: Your body has recovered from the fresh cycle. Time for FET!
explanation: FET advantages over fresh: 1) No ovarian stimulation = no OHSS risk, 2) Your body is rested and balanced, 3) Frozen embryos have been 'tested by time' (weak ones don't survive freezing), 4) Success rates often HIGHER than fresh! You have {{frozen_embryo_count}} frozen embryos.
next_steps: Start period Day 1 call. Day 2-3 baseline scan. Then {{protocol_type}} protocol: Medicated (estrogen pills/patches) OR Natural (monitor ovulation). Transfer 2-3 weeks later.
reassurance: The failed fresh cycle taught us valuable info about your response. FET is a fresh start with better odds! Many patients succeed on FET after fresh fails. Stay hopeful! üåà
call_to_action: Rest this month or start next period? Your choice. When ready, call on Day 1 and we'll begin!

context: Aaj se estrogen start ho raha hai.
explanation: Aap {{estrogen_type}} logi - {{estrogen_dose}} {{route}}. Estrogen aapki uterine lining ko thick aur fluffy banata hai (jaise pillow) taaki embryo chipak sake. Target: 7-12mm lining.
next_steps: {{schedule}} - Pills: 2mg twice daily with food / Patches: Change every 3 days / Injections: Every 3 days. Pehli lining check Day {{check_day}} ko.
reassurance: Estrogen natural hormone hai - pregnant women mein bhi hota hai. Side effects mild: breast tenderness, mood swings, headache. Sab normal! üíä
call_to_action: Aaj se start karo. Same time daily. Calendar pe mark karo. Next scan {{scan_date}} ko.

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, it's Nurse {{nurse_name}} with your scan results!
context: [EXCITED TONE] Great news - your lining looks absolutely perfect for transfer!
explanation: Today's scan showed {{lining_thickness}}mm with a beautiful trilaminar pattern - that's the three-layer look we want. It's like a perfect mattress for the embryo. Your estrogen level is {{e2_level}}, which is right where we want it.
next_steps: [SPEAK SLOWLY] Here's the plan: You'll start progesterone {{progesterone_type}} on {{start_date}}. {{administration_details}}. Your transfer is scheduled for {{transfer_date}} at {{transfer_time}} - that's {{transfer_days}} days after starting progesterone.
reassurance: This is the moment we've been building toward with all the estrogen! Your lining is textbook perfect. The embryo is going to have a wonderful home.
call_to_action: [CLEAR INSTRUCTIONS] Do you have the progesterone ready? {{specific_instructions}}. And remember - once you start progesterone, timing is critical. Don't miss any doses. Set reminders on your phone if needed.
contact_info: Any questions about the progesterone administration? We can have you come in for the first injection if you want to see how it's done. Call us at {{clinic_phone}}.

eventName: All Frozen Embryos Used - Last FET
greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, it's Dr. {{doctor_name}}. I wanted to talk with you before this transfer.
context: [EMPATHETIC] This is your last frozen embryo from the original retrieval cycle.
explanation: You have one {{stage}} embryo - Grade {{grade}} - remaining in storage. This is it from that cohort. I want to make sure you understand what it means: if this transfer doesn't work, you'll need to do another egg retrieval to get more embryos.
next_steps: The transfer will proceed as usual on {{transfer_date}}. Everything is optimized for success. But I want you to be mentally prepared for both outcomes: pregnancy, or the need for another retrieval cycle.
reassurance: [PAUSE] It only takes one embryo to make a baby. This embryo has already proven itself by surviving freezing and thawing. Grade {{grade}} has a {{success_rate}}% success rate. I'm hopeful, and I want you to stay hopeful too. But if it doesn't work, we'll make a plan together for next steps.
call_to_action: For now, focus on this transfer. Stay positive but realistic. After the transfer, we'll do everything to support a healthy pregnancy. If it doesn't work, take time to grieve, then we'll talk about what's next - maybe retrieving again, maybe donor eggs, whatever feels right for you.
contact_info: I'm here for you either way. Questions now? You can reach me anytime at {{clinic_phone}}.

eventName: FET Conversion to Fresh - Spontaneous Ovulation
context: You ovulated spontaneously during FET prep.
explanation: Today's scan shows you already ovulated (ruptured follicle visible) even though we were trying to suppress ovulation. Your LH: {{lh_level}} (surged). This throws off our timing - we can't predict exact progesterone days now.
next_steps: CANCEL this FET cycle. Stop all meds. Period will come in ~2 weeks. Next cycle, we'll use stronger suppression (birth control pills OR GnRH agonist) to prevent this.
reassurance: This is frustrating but actually good - means you ovulate strongly! Just need better control. Some clinics actually prefer natural ovulation (modified natural FET). We'll adjust! üîÑ
call_to_action: Stop estrogen today. Rest this month. Call on Day 1 of next period to start again with adjusted protocol.

context: Today's scan showed a polyp in your uterus.
explanation: There's a {{polyp_size}}mm endometrial polyp (benign growth) at {{polyp_location}}. Polyps can interfere with implantation - they act like an IUD, preventing embryo attachment. We need to remove it before FET.
next_steps: Hysteroscopy scheduled {{surgery_date}} (5-10 min procedure, local/light sedation). Remove polyp, biopsy lining. Recovery: 1-2 days. Wait one period after surgery, then FET in {{timeline}}.
reassurance: Polyps are super common (10-20% of women). Removal is simple and increases success rates! Good we found it before wasting an embryo! üî¨
call_to_action: Stop FET meds. Do hysteroscopy. This delay will IMPROVE your chances, not hurt them. Silver lining!

explanation: We transferred {{embryos_transferred}} embryos, and BOTH implanted! Two gestational sacs visible, both with heartbeats at {{heartbeat1_rate}} and {{heartbeat2_rate}} bpm. Fraternal twins (two separate embryos)!
next_steps: Continue all meds. Twins = higher risk pregnancy - more monitoring needed. OB referral NOW (not 12 weeks). Early ultrasounds every 2 weeks. Expect higher pregnancy symptoms (nausea, fatigue).
reassurance: Twins are exciting and come with challenges! You'll need more rest, better nutrition, high-risk OB care. But thousands of women carry twins successfully! We'll support you closely! üéâ
call_to_action: Increase protein (100g/day), hydrate more, REST MORE. No heavy activity. Report any bleeding/severe pain immediately. Next scan {{next_scan}}.

greeting: Hi {{patient_name}}, it's Dr. {{doctor_name}}. How are you feeling?
context: [GENTLE] I know the miscarriage was heartbreaking. I wanted to check in and see if you're ready to talk about trying again.
explanation: [EMPATHY] Physically, your body has recovered - it's been {{months_since_loss}} months since your loss. Hormonally, everything is back to normal. Your lining looks healthy on the scan. Medically, you're ready for another FET. But the bigger question is: are YOU ready emotionally?
next_steps: [NO PRESSURE] There's no rush. Some patients want to try immediately - it helps them feel hopeful again. Others need 6 months or a year to heal emotionally. Both are completely valid. When you're ready, we'll do another FET with the same protocol or adjust if you want.
reassurance: [PAUSE] Miscarriage after IVF is devastating because you've already invested so much. But please know - having a positive pregnancy, even if it ended in loss, means your embryos CAN implant and your body CAN get pregnant. That's actually a good sign for future attempts. Many patients who miscarry go on to have successful pregnancies next time.
call_to_action: Take all the time you need. There's no expiration date on your frozen embryos. They'll wait for you. If you want counseling support, we have resources. When you're ready, just call and we'll start the FET prep.
contact_info: I'm thinking of you. Reach out anytime - {{clinic_phone}}. No pressure.
